data.text: Noseless Bicycle Saddles for Bicycle Touring?

Hello everyone, let's say it simply: my girlfriend has her intimate parts sour when we cycle for a few days. We're looking for solutions: has anyone tried saddles without a nose , like the one in the picture? Would you recommend it? Thanks in advance for your advice! 😊
Sour!
data.author: Alyn Stickleback

data.text: or sore?
data.author: Francois Swanepoel

data.text:
Had so many problems back in the day, especially on the road bike. I don't have experience with the saddle you mentioned, but for me this saddle saved me (fysio gel) https://www.terry-comfort.de/en/touring-women.php
TouringComfort Women • Terry Comfort
terry-comfort.de

data.text:

data.author: Slawomir Olejnik

data.text: i tried all the suggestions (the terry saddles, the specialized saddles w genital nets, etc ad nauseam) & my current cheapo noseless saddle changed literally everything. i strongly encourage her to give one a try
data.author: Katie F-S

data.text: I tried one. Constantly felt like I was falling forward off the seat. Could never relax my legs.
data.author: Pedaling Pete

data.text: Work on back flexibility in order to sit back on sit bones and cycle more.
data.author: Jane Hawkins

data.text: I gave it a try and it is great but not rock steady. After 3000 km i had to make it rigid as both pads sliding sideways. The good thing is you can adjust the pad separation. i have it but is it necessary for men only when prostatitis shows up. (i am healthy thanx god). my current saddle has also a nice gap in the middle.
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: this is my current one and is top
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: .
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: My wife uses Specialized for women... Have a look at it...
data.author: Doc Marco

data.text: My wife swears by the ISM noseless saddles, worth a look, they are well designed, almost all your weight is on your sit bones and nothing else. The PR range is most suitable for touring, but if you ride drop bars maybe others like the PN. It’s important (more than usual) to get the right width. ISM do test saddles by post.
data.author: Geraint Mandrake

data.text: I've got an ISM it made a difference very quickly, but eventually I realised it still wasn't quite right. As you say it's very important to have the right width for your sit bones - I needed a wider one in the end.
data.author: Pete Myers

data.text: I think I’ll change to an ism pr3.0 before our next tour. Worth clarifying that they are designed to support on a different part of pelvis (pubic rami) to the most prominent sit bone that all other saddles are designed for, and require quite different setup/positioning, they really are something else, lots of video and info on website: https://ismseat.com/performance-saddles/
data.author: Geraint Mandrake

data.text: Was “sour” the word you wanted?

data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: I use a Wittkop Medicus. I was a little skeptical because they are quite inexpensive but have no regrets.
data.author: Cindy C. Rogers

data.text: Get a bike fit. My wife had exactly this issue and it was fixed by fitting much shorter cranks. Saddle pain had *nothing* to do with the saddle. Only a bike fit can tell you what you don't know you don't know!
data.author: Michael Bryant

data.text: totally agree. I had similar issues but the bike fit brought the fun back in cycling.
data.author: Cilla Blank

data.text: I've gone through several types of saddle over the years but have ridden with one from ISM for the past several years. It's the type without the nose and has plenty of space for the tender goods. Just in case I didn't like it, i also bought a Brooks B17 but it's still in the box.
data.author: Rob Brunk

data.text: Due to a groin issue I used Hibson Easy Seat & Pro for a couple of years - they did the job but I'd say finding the right saddle is a better long term solution. Also look at the WTB saddle test ride programme.
data.author: Damian Ashman

data.text:
She should get a wide seat with ample width to comfortably accommodate her sit bones (most saddles designed for men won't be wide enough) with a channel. Then slightly point the nose down so that her weight is resting on her sit bones and not on her genitals. Wearing normal leggings or shorts (not bike shorts which can trap moisture and add more pressure) also help. This is what I use, but there are a lots of similar saddles on the market now. Any bike shop should carry some like this that she can try https://www.amazon.com/Selle-Royal-Respiro-Relaxed-Saddle/dp/B009O0D0HM/ref=asc_df_B009O0D0HM/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=241987970787&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=4038630613105647743&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=1013585&hvtargid=pla-441119572760&th=1&psc=1
Selle Royal Respiro Saddles
amazon.com
data.author: Brenna Sullivan

data.text: I heard about those, but for some people its still uncomfortable. If it's not pressing against some parts, it will be pressing more against pelvis bones. Not a good idea to decrease pressure area. She should measure span between bones and buy saddle accordingly. Also, there are Brooks saddles, but you have to use them for some time for the leather to form into your bum 😜 A lot of long haul travellers are using them.
data.author: Krzysztof Albinger

data.text: Bullshit.
data.author: Kobra Cobra

data.text: I had the same problem switched to selle and have had no problems
data.author: Kerry Russell

data.text:
https://www.ergonbike.com/en/saddle-selector.html#__11298419 Important to consider the width of your sit bones, as mentioned before.
Saddle Selector · Ergon Bike
ergonbike.com
data.author: Ingeborg Kauper

data.text: Sour? If her "bits" are getting sore that's a seat /posture issue so get a bike fit, but if her bits are getting smelly / fungal infections then it is a pants issue. Perhaps look into merino liners instead of the usual synthetic padded pants. I'm dreaming of the day someone creates natural breathable padded bike pants.
data.author: Gracie Trish

data.text: This is not a saddle issue. It’s about fit. Find a place where they can do a proper fitting for your girlfriend.
data.author: Ali Albayrak

data.text: I suffer from prostatitis. Went to a noseless saddle 10 years ago. Works for me. I use a 'spongy wonder'..... Canadian brand. Well made with stainless frame. At first you seem to lose a lot of bike control because you can't pinch the nose between your legs on bumpy downhills, for example. But after a few weeks you get accustomed to it. It's taken me most of the way around the world.
data.author: Madhavananda Das Brssm

data.text: Overall bike fit so important. Once achieved, consider the saddle a point of reference for movement, not a seat. Work core strength
data.author: Douglas Carnall

data.text: I've switched from a 'normal' saddle to a brooks leather one years ago and will never go back. The pain is partly caused by the synthetic saddle cover and because it's probably too soft. Get a good pair of cycling shorts with padding (no gel!!). They are much more breathable and that will make a world of difference. I think a bike fitting is always a good idea, though they can be pricey.
data.author: Jessica Kittle

data.text: I use Lidls gel saddles for touring; never had a problem
data.author: Suzanne Hopwood

data.text: If a saddle does not have a nose it is much more difficult to maintain balance on the bike. I tried one of these curved saddles without a nose and it wasn't a success. You have to sit much more upright to maintain balance.
data.author: Donald Howell Miller

data.text: As Michael said use the great opportunity of bike fitting. Find a bike shop that offers this service for many years and also have a look for some high quality padded underwear. Like from Assos - the pad has not to be thick but suitable for sensitive skin and should have left tons of damping ability after many miles. In thick soft pads you sink down through and will sit again on the saddle after a couple of miles. And than you will have the same problems again. The Charge Laddle helped many femals to sit longer on their bikes. Also Terry builds some fine saddles for the female ergonomics and some are happy with SQLab or Ergon. Greetings
data.author: Sebastian Börnecke

data.text: The reason for the love of your company 😂🌹
data.author: Hamid Ahmadi

data.text: I tightly added to my normal soft saddle (synthetic cover) a good hide layer (easily found at any leather shop), stitched around, saved money, 20 yrs ago, and never looked back...
data.author: John Terranova

data.text:
Buy yourself a Gilles Berthoud Aspin saddle and you troubles are over. https://berthoudcycles.fr/en/520-leather-saddle-aspin-black.html
Leather saddle Berthoud Aspin black
berthoudcycles.fr
data.author: Johan Barelds

data.text: Good evening By tilting the saddle a few degrees forward I made this for my wife, with successive attempts we find the right inclination
data.author: Lionel Trimaille

data.text: Just so you know Blaise, it's sore, hopefully not sour.
data.author: Terry Shaw

data.text: yes this got me too. Lol
data.author: Andrea Collisson

data.text: We are all different in size so its important to support the seat bones rather then the soft tissue. If you can, measure the distance between both seat bones and look for a saddle of that width. Brooks make very comfy saddles which do take a little getting used to and offer cut outs that will help with sensitive areas. Hope this helps
data.author: Tim Bridgman

data.text: This is guaranteed the best solution

data.author: Paul Cole

data.text: We have put noseless seats on all of our bicycles and love them.
data.author: Matthew Luciano-toulany

data.text:
My partner and I have been using The Spongy Wonder from Canada for about 10 years. No issues and could never go back to a seat with a nose. They are adjustable side to side to fit your sit bones and they are reasonably priced. The website isn't the flashiest, but the product works. :-) Good luck! https://spongywonder.com/
spongywonder.com
spongywonder.com
data.author: Jeff Weitzel

data.text: Me personally, I tried everything The only thing that works is the bike and saddle fitting, good bib shorts. And don't shave your private parts before any long ride
data.author: Shahy Ali
